description: Demolition of existing pool house and erection of a single storey pool house, plant room and bar.
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The proposed development would fail to preserve the character and appearance of the conservation area due to the loss of/harm to mature trees which contribute positively to the significance of the Conservation Area and there would be no public benefits to outweigh the identified less than substantial harm, thereby conflicting with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended) and Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Core Strategy 2012 and the NPPF (2023).

The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of cogent information that the proposed development would not result in harm to the health and longevity of trees of amenity value covered by a tree protection order through damage to the Root Protection Areas. The proposal would not accord with Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.
